Reviewing the resource utilization matrix may come later in the process, once the strategic plan has been updated and specific IT needs have been identified. However, without first updating the strategic plan to align with the expansion decision, it may be difficult to accurately evaluate resource utilization and make informed decisions about resource allocation.

questions.question_text: Which of the following provides the BEST evidence of an IT risk-aware culture across an enterprise?

choices.D: Request an update to the business case.
choices.C: Re-evaluate the project in the portfolio.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Request an update to the business case

When financial assumptions supporting a project change, the first governance action that should be taken is to request an update to the business case. The business case outlines the rationale, costs, benefits, and financial projections of the project. If the financial assumptions have changed, it is essential to update the business case to reflect the new realities accurately.

Once the business case is updated, subsequent actions such as scheduling an interim project review, requesting a risk assessment, or re-evaluating the project in the portfolio can be undertaken based on the updated information provided in the revised business case. However, without an updated business case reflecting the changed financial assumptions, it would be premature to proceed with other governance actions.

The business case is the document that justifies the need for a project and outlines the expected benefits. When the financial assumptions supporting a project change, it is important to update the business case to reflect the new information. This will help to ensure that the project is still aligned with the organization's strategic goals and that it is still worth pursuing.
